title: Sudden RADS Error
body:
I was logged in on LCU Beta and then suddenly my Play button was greyed out and said something was wrong with my connection. Restarted and I get that message on LCU and can't log in. Legacy client gives a RADS error.

Have tried:

* Added exceptions for League in my firewall

* Restarted computer

* Disabled and re-enabled wifi

* Ran as administrator (both clients)

* Currently doing full repair...

Why would it suddenly stop working? I don't get it. Between the time the client was fine and the time it said I had a connection error, the only thing I did was take a nap. So it's not something I did. Help?

replies.body: The grayed out play button can be caused by an unstable connection that can't reach the matchmaking portal.  If a relog doesn't fix this, try out the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help strengthen your network.  The below step provided can certainly help, and also a part of the above guide too!  I hope that helps!

> If you guys are experiencing a RADS error and your play button in the client is grayed out, try flushing your DNS. I just had the problem myself.
> 
> First, close out of league and open Command Prompt (Windows) by searching for "cmd" in your start menu (without quotations, obviously.)
> 
> Next, when the Command Promp appears, type "ipconfig /flushdns" (again, without the quotations.)
> 
> After you've done that, it should immediately flush your dns. Open League, log in, and check to make sure that functionality is restored to your Play button once more.
> 
> Lemme know if this helped, my dudes.

Copy-pasting this from the thread I made. Let me know if this does the job.
Same here, it's something on their side obviously if you aren't the only one.
